description: The "synthetic.academic_terms" table represents periods or sessions within an academic institution, identified by a unique "term_id" and characterized by a "term_code" and "term_name." It includes date ranges for both the term and its registration period, and indicates whether the term is current, with timestamped entries for creation and last update. As it has no foreign key relationships, this table likely serves as a standalone entity within the database to encapsulate academic scheduling information.

columns.name: term_id
columns.description: This column represents a unique identifier for academic terms within an educational institution's system. The sequential values suggest an automatic incrementing sequence to ensure each term is distinctly identifiable.

columns.name: term_code
columns.description: Purpose unclear from available data. The values appear to be randomly generated strings and do not provide insight into their meaning or usage.

columns.name: term_name
columns.description: Purpose unclear from available data. The sample values do not provide discernible information connecting them to a specific academic term.

columns.name: start_date
columns.description: This column records the start dates for academic terms, likely representing when each term begins during different years. The values indicate specific weekdays and account for variations in daylight saving time within the Central time zone.

columns.name: end_date
columns.description: This column represents the final date by which an academic term concludes within the institution's calendar. The dates indicate variations in end dates presumably due to differing start times or specific term durations.

columns.name: registration_start
columns.description: This column represents the start date for when students can begin registering for academic terms. The dates vary, indicating they align with specific term schedules throughout the academic year.

columns.name: registration_end
columns.description: This column represents the date by which registration for an academic term must be completed. If not specified, this deadline may not be applicable or determined for every term.

columns.name: is_current
columns.description: Indicates whether an academic term is currently active. The default setting suggests that terms are generally not considered active unless specified otherwise.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: Records the date and time when a new academic term entry is created. The timestamp defaults to the current moment when the entry is added.

columns.name: updated_at
columns.description: This column represents the timestamp indicating when the academic term record was last updated. It defaults to the current timestamp but may remain null if not explicitly set.

indexes.index_definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX academic_terms_pkey ON synthetic.academic_terms USING btree (term_id)
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX academic_terms_term_code_key ON synthetic.academic_terms USING btree (term_code)
